originalQuery:
-- Find out what the PATIENT table is for
SELECT documentation 
FROM _metadata
WHERE table_name = 'PATIENT' 
  AND column_name IS NULL;
description: Get the documentation for the PATIENT table

results.documentation: The PATIENT table contains one record for each patient in your system. The data contained in each record consists of demographics, PCP and primary location information, registration information, and other information.

originalQuery:
-- See what the most important columns in the PATIENT table mean
SELECT 
  column_name, 
  documentation
FROM _metadata
WHERE table_name = 'PATIENT' 
  AND column_name IN ('PAT_ID', 'PAT_MRN_ID', 'PAT_NAME', 'BIRTH_DATE', 'SEX_C_NAME')
ORDER BY column_name;
description: Get descriptions for key columns in the PATIENT table

results.documentation: The date on which the patient was born.
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used by other tables to link to PATIENT.
The patient's medical record number (MRN), of the type associated with the patient's current primary location.
The patientï¿½s name in the format Lastname, Firstname MI.
The category number corresponding to the patient's sex.

originalQuery:
-- Search documentation and summarize by table
SELECT 
  table_name,
  COUNT(*) as relevant_columns
FROM _metadata
WHERE documentation LIKE '%allergy%'
GROUP BY table_name
ORDER BY relevant_columns DESC;
description: Find which tables are most relevant to allergies

originalQuery:
-- This finds direct foreign key relationships to the PATIENT table
SELECT 
  table_name,
  documentation
FROM _metadata
WHERE column_name = 'PAT_ID'
ORDER BY table_name
LIMIT 10;
description: Find the first 10 tables that link directly to a patient

results.documentation: The unique ID for the patient related to the guarantor of the account.
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
Patient ID
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
The ID of the patient of the event record at the effective time.
The patient from the invoice to which the payment in the remittance image record is posted.
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
The unique ID assigned to the patient record (EPT .1).
The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

originalQuery:
-- Join our documentation with SQLite's schema info
SELECT 
  ti.name as column_name,
  ti.type as data_type,
  md.documentation
FROM pragma_table_info('ORDER_PROC') ti
LEFT JOIN _metadata md 
  ON ti.name = md.column_name 
  AND md.table_name = 'ORDER_PROC'
ORDER BY ti.pk
LIMIT 15;
description: Get a preview of the schema for the ORDER_PROC table

results.documentation: The unique ID of the order record associated with this procedure order.
The unique ID of the patient record for this order. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
Interface laboratory name.
The unique ID of the lab or other resulting agency, such as radiology, that provided the order results.
The date when the procedure order was placed.
The order type category number for the procedure order.
The unique ID of the  procedure record corresponding to this order. This can be used to link to CLARITY_EAP.
A brief summary of the procedure order.
The order class category number of the procedure order.
The unique ID of the provider prescribing or authorizing the order.

Indicates whether or not this order contains abnormal results. This column will contain a Y if there are abnormal results and an N or null if it does not. For orders with lab component results, if any one component of this order has an abnormal result value then this will hold a Y.
The unique ID of the provider under whose name this order should be billed. This might be the same ID as the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID.
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
